aroma.notes: Nice ruddy, slightly warm spicy 'vanilla' scent.

acidity.notes: Nice rounded cherry note. A small part of the overall taste, but distinctly there.

sweetness.notes: Noticeably sweeter than, say, the Congo. Complex — many different sensations hitting me.

body.notes: Not quite a light syrup — more delicate. Not sure whether this can or should be improved, but I like it for this origin.

finish.notes: Vanilla or earthy finish on sip. Mouth feels pleasantly neutral.

flavor: First and overall impression is a warm, earthy, vanilla flavor — there is more emphasis on the earthy qualities than the emerging cherry note. Aftertaste is balanced between tea-like and acidic — I don't feel like running for water. I like this.
notes: Drawdown was remarkably fast here as well as the Congo on grind 23. Same 8 second bloom swirl, though with 70g of water as this coffee is lighter thus takes up more volumetric room.
actionItem: Grind at 22 to explore how this changes
